comments: a(k) = k has only one solution, namely k=7. - _Jon Perry_, Oct 30 2014As 2 is a primitive root of 11, all integers 1 through 10 are present. - _Jon Perry_, Oct 30 2014
references: H. Cohn, A Second Course in Number Theory, Wiley, NY, 1962, p. 256.
I. M. Vinogradov, Elements of Number Theory, pp. 220 ff.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,0,-1,1).
prog: (Sage) [power_mod(2,n,11) for n in xrange(0, 78)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 03 2009(PARI) a(n)=lift(Mod(2,11)^n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 02 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
